In 1910, the LZ-7 "Deutschland" was flown from
the Zeppelin works in Friedrichshafen to Dusseldorf.
There, on June 22, passenger service was officially
inaugurated with flights to Frankfurt and Baden-
Mint Stamp: The mint stamp on this Cover, showing
the "Deutschland" in flight over Friedrichshafen, was
issued by Upper Volta in 1976. In the background is
Lake Constance (Bodensee), a popular resort area.
Baden. Soon several more Zeppelins were added to
the fleet, and the service linked most of Germany's
major cities. Before World
War 1,
DELAG had
flown 34,228 passengers over 107,213 miles — with-
out an injury or fatality.
Postmark: This Cover was postmarked in Friedrichs-
hafen, Germany on June 22, 1984, the exact anni-
versary of the inauguration of the first passenger

properties.sfomuseum:description: Airmail flight cover, part of International Tributes to the History of Flight series by the Postal Commemorative Society; white envelope with full color illustration cachet and inset stamp commemorating first regular passenger service on June 22, 1910, in Friedrichshafen, Germany, by Count Ferdinand von Zeppelin with LZ-7 “Deutschland” airship; commemorative cancellation stamp dated June 22, 1984 in Friedrichshafen; includes information on reverse.
